Description: Rim sherd of Corinthian pottery lekane with conical spur (probably from a spurred ribbon handle) projecting from flat rim; exterior: broad black band at rim and over spur above part of wide added red band; interior: black on rim and on spur with set of seven or more verticals in added white extending over spur; glazed on inside, fired red-brown, with added white band near junction with rim.
Curator's comments: The decoration on the upper surface of the rim finds parallels with British Museum 1886,401.994 but the zigzag pattern found on the exterior surface of that sherd does not match that here; while the zig-zag is not continuous, and could have turned into glaze at the handle area, the red band on the exterior of this sherd cannot be related to 1886,0401.994.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.218) (phase 3)
